experience: You and Brian both know Stephanie Tate, Chetan Nadgouda, and 5 others
Brian can introduce you to 3 people at Facebook
Qualities of Highly Capable (Software Development) Teams

Elon Musk unveiled #Tesla's new Semi truck and (in a surprise) a second-generation Roadster. The truck is supposed to get 500 miles per charge, while the Roadster is said to achieve 620 miles. Watch the full event cut down to 9 minutes.
New hire or new bot? - Microsoft Life

Responsible for leading our engineering team.  Leading by example is my preferred approach, rolling up my sleeves to write code, design projects, strategize on defining and reaching business goals and conducting product experiments.  Working in a start-up environment, I help establish appropriate MVP-level solutions for the many challenges to be tackled.  Architected and built web-based, cross-platform application framework and foundational application development frameworks.  Established build system and deployment automation systems and created macOS and iOS client applications for platform.I also help the team develop and hone their skills and craftsmanship, while developing a good balance necessary for frequent shipping of code. We’re investing in each individual to encourage growth from "good developers" to "excellent professional engineers".  I help facilitate a team-wide understanding of the product vision and help balance our priorities across the large scope of work that is necessary to build out our platform and applications.  The goal of my work is to help build an great team that builds an amazing product that reflects a high level of passion and craftsmanship.- Quickly promoted to Director of Engineering due to technical skills and team leadership performance- Produced strategy for fulfilling product & technology roadmaps against business goals in collaboration with executive staff, CEO, and board of directors- Hired, mentored, managed and led team of 20+ engineers- Architected and led development of Windows, macOS & iOS user applications for contextual intelligence platform- Spearheaded application development process from experimentation & prototyping through customer release- Designed and built custom hybrid native+web, cross-platform application framework- Engaged in customer-focused experimentation and design iteration- Implemented rapid iteration and continuous deployment processes and support systems

- Trained and mentored team of 6 engineering IC’s & leads + project manager- Designed, directed, and was responsible for delivery of custom software projects- Improved team productivity 10x, resulting in 30% net profit margin increase- Responsible for 750% sales growth in 2 years through focus on team execution & delivery with quality, within budget, and 100% on schedule / 60% ahead of schedule- Developed solutions for clients including Chrysler, Dave & Busters, Hotels.com, and Crain Communications- Specialized in web-based sites/apps and mobile solutions - Initiated strategic partnerships with design & marketing companies to become their preferred developer to build out the tech to support their designs - Led strategy and design of solutions specific to client needs, including estimating, budgeting, planning, developing specifications, and managing the build of the projects - Established primary technical direction and set overall coding standards, processes, and quality level - Sample projects include the development of asset management solutions, interactive kiosk applications, e-commerce solutions, marketing websites, internal productivity and management applications, integrations with custom API’s, social media and other 3rd party integrations - Primary tech utilized includes: HTML5, CSS3, SASS, Javascript, jQuery, ASP.Net/C#, PHP, MySql, MSSQL, Wordpress, Drupal, DotNetNuke, Grunt, Node.js, git, Bamboo, JIRA, Photoshop, Objective-C, Swift, IIS, ApacheSamples of work available at http://paradox-customs.com

- Provided custom software solutions and technical consulting to companies who needed additional outside expertise. - Specialized in web-based applications for support of back office operations such as customer records management, scheduling systems, factory floor tracking systems, multi-level hosting reseller solutions, online school systems, e-commerce solutions and marketing websites. - Primary tech utilized includes: HTML, CSS, ASP.Net/C#, Javascript, Adobe Flex, MSSQL, DotNetNuke, Photoshop, SVN, IIS

Joined team after the company acquired former start-up, Wholesale ISP.  Led software development team for the build-out of .NET/C#-based web-management platform for the provisioning, authentication, private label / branding, reporting, and management of virtual ISP services on a national level.
Coach for Jr. High Robotics Team

Served as coach for Bedford Jr. High robotics team.  First two years at the FLL (FIRST Lego League) level and then at the FTC (FIRST Tech Challenge) level.  Responsible for coaching the kids and teaching robotics build and programming principals, along with required marketing, strategy, team building, and other required core concepts.  Enjoyed helping kids explore their interest in the robotics / technology areas related to this competition.
Coach for Jr. High Robotics Team

Served as coach for Bedford Jr. High robotics team.  First two years at the FLL (FIRST Lego League) level and then at the FTC (FIRST Tech Challenge) level.  Responsible for coaching the kids and teaching robotics build and programming principals, along with required marketing, strategy, team building, and other required core concepts.  Enjoyed helping kids explore their interest in the robotics / technology areas related to this competition.
Boy Scouts of America > Cub Scouts

Served as den leader for the 2006 group of Tiger Cub Scouts through their first 3 years.  Focused on helping the kids work together as a team to accomplish their individual goals and enjoying their cub scouting experience, as well as coordinated the involvement of other parents in the program.

recommendations: Kaj Pedersen
VP of Operations at Xinova, LLC
November 1, 2017, Kaj was senior to Brian but didn’t manage directly

Brian was both a strong individual contributor and leader of our software organization.  I appreciated Brian's enthusiasm and passion with software - his unique and natural comprehension of software development is a hallmark that will resonate with those who worked with Brian.  It is this talent that will serve him well as he pursues those roles, where his ability to lead and code, can be utilized to the full. Brian's entrepreneurial mindset was another powerful attribute of his contributions.  He intuitively understands how to translate requirements into solutions that are of value to the business.  I was always struck by his willingness to take the initiative to make things better and do so in collaboration with others on his team.  Brian helped us at Atlas Informatics through these strengths to ensure we made ourselves more effective and productive, even under the most challenging of circumstances that often come with the startup experience.Personally, I found Brian to be a reliable and trusted partner to our engineering efforts at Atlas.  He was open with the challenges and willing to find ways to creatively solve our problems.  He also felt concern for his team and made sure they were represented effectively to leadership in the company.  A company looking for an engineer that is strongly capable, coupled with leadership characteristics, will be well placed to consider Brian.

Ace Levenberg
Software Engineer at Amperity
October 20, 2017, Ace reported directly to Brian

I worked on Brian's team for almost two years.  Thanks to his great leadership and mentoring I learned more in that two years than I ever have before. Brian went out of his way to make sure the team and I had what we needed to execute our engineering plan.  His ability to guide us through solving problems and to facilitate the creation of an amazing engineering team was truly inspiring. I've spent many hours pair programing with him and working side by side building features together. When the times got tough Brian was always there with us, rolling up his sleeves and writing code.  I would work with Brian again in a second, he would be a great asset to any team.

For the past two years, I have had the pleasure of working with Brian as we ideated, iterated, and executed on Atlas’ vision. Brian has a keen ability to balance MVP with a well thought out design and architecture, enabling fast iteration on product ideas. His curiosity, energy, craftsmanship, and fearlessness towards anything he takes on brings ease, clarity, and fun to what may seem like a crazy rollercoaster ride called a startup. Whether it is engineering a new product capability or mentoring his team, Brian delivers with purpose and desire to make a positive impact on everything he does. In summary, you really want him as your partner when developing new products.

Brian has the amazing ability to turn dreams into reality.I have worked with Brian for three years as at Atlas, collaborating on building complex user experiences for search. He has been an indispensable partner and mentor.Brian has always impressed me with how he approaches every challenge with excitement and a positive outlook. His keen sense for user experience, his ability to prioritize smartly, and an insatiable curiosity enables us to product ideas from concept to real in record time. It is thrilling to arrive in the morning and hear Brian say “hey, take a look at this.” - and seeing our designs come to life. His creativity and drive extend beyond work. I always love talking with him about the awesome projects he does with his family - like building a cabinet for a video game emulator or airbrushing some green fiery guitars!Brian simply _makes things happen_, and his contributions will benefit any team.

Brian joined Atlas as a senior developer and quickly demonstrated his leadership skills. It was inevitable that he would become our Director of Engineering. Brian is an outstanding partner when it comes to transforming the business strategy into development priorities. In addition to working with the executive team to plan and prioritize engineering objectives and resources, Brian is a hands-on leader. Brian’s can-do attitude is infectious; working shoulder to shoulder with the engineers, inspires, mentors, and helps tackle the tough challenges. Brian has also helped grow the team, finding the best talent and helping to grow and nurture their development. Finding a way to really draw the best out of each of our engineers, Brian has help us build a world class development organization. He would be great addition to any organization.

Best recruiter I've ever worked with!  Evan recruited me into Ivy Softworks while he was at iMatch.  Of all of the recruiters I worked with, Evan was the most helpful, investing himself in helping me find the right opportunity and positioning myself well for it.  He brought a number of our other best team members to the company and then we were able to bring him onboard as our in-house recruiter.  He's been instrumental in building out our team, coming up with innovative tactics that I've yet seen from anyone else.  Through these creative approaches, he dramatically improved both the quantity and quality of our candidate flow, optimizing our hiring process for efficiency.  Evan converted our culture to one where everyone is engaged in recruiting and building out our team.  With an affinity towards engineering, I'd hire Evan in a heartbeat to help build out a technical team!

summary: Entrepreneur and Director of Engineering with over 20 years experience building successful teams and developing software solutions on many different platforms. Served as technical lead or as business owner within a number of start-ups since the mid-90's, participating in executive leadership, building out and managing the supporting engineering teams.  Led strategy and development of new products, solutions, and web sites/apps. Assisted clients in determining the appropriate solution specific for their needs. Extensive experience leading software development projects from the frontlines - from writing code to integration of team code to steering overall project.Outside of work, first and foremost, I love spending time with my wife and kids. From adventures on the road with our Harley’s to the many, many hobbies we engage in, we love to do it all together. Into a bit of everything, I enjoy playing guitar, video game & virtual reality development, teaching kids technology and robotics, board & tabletop games, airbrush & painting, tattooing, just to name a few.
name: Brian Krabach
title: Principal Software Engineer at Microsoft
